channel.title: Photo of the Day
channel.description: Photo of the Day - Made with love by RSSHub(https://github.com/DIYgod/RSSHub)

item.title: Sturdy Oak
item.description:
An oak tree stands tall in Delaware Park, Buffalo, New York. The March 2005 issue featured a story about famed urban park designer Frederick Law Olmsted.
纽约州布法罗市特拉华公园，一棵橡树高高矗立。2005年3月的那期杂志刊登了一篇关于著名城市公园设计师弗雷德里克·劳·奥尔姆斯特德的报道。
item.author: Melissa Farlow, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Winter Dip
item.description:
The air is 20 degrees below zero, but an overflowing thermal spring near Gardiner, Montana, makes this portion of the Yellowstone River a delightful place for a winter dip.
空气温度为零下20度，但蒙大拿州加德纳附近的温泉溢出，使得黄石河的这一部分成为冬季潜水的好去处。
item.author: Annie Griffiths, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Prayer Flags
item.description:
A monk hoists prayer flags during Losar, the Tibetan New Year, in Lhasa, Tibet. During the 15-day celebration, observers participate in a series of rituals to set the course for the year ahead.
在西藏拉萨，一名僧侣在藏历新年洛萨升起祈祷旗。在为期15天的庆祝活动中，观察家们参加了一系列仪式，为下一年定下方向。
item.author: Maria Stenzel, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: January Blizzard
item.description:
A cattle farmer closes the barn door after tending to his herd in a snowstorm in McGregor, North Dakota. This particular blizzard in January 1985 saw windchills as cold as 80 degrees below zero Fahrenheit.
北达科他州麦格雷戈的一场暴风雪中，一位养牛户在照料他的牛群后关上了牲口棚的门。1985年1月的这场暴风雪中，风寒的温度高达华氏零下80度。
item.author: Annie Griffiths, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Temperature Check
item.description:
While this scene of a hostess checking a nightclub-goer's temperature in Singapore seems eerily familiar now, it first appeared in a January 2010 story about the swine flu epidemic.
在新加坡，一位女主人检查夜总会游客体温的场景现在似乎很熟悉，但这一场景最早出现在2010年1月的一篇关于猪流感疫情的报道中。
item.author: David McLain, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Polar Hunt
item.description:
In Svalbard, Norway, a polar bear roams the ice hunting for bearded seals. The polar bear's metabolism requires a large amount of fat, so the bear will often consume more than four pounds of seal fat a day.
在挪威的斯瓦尔巴群岛，一只北极熊在冰面上游荡，寻找有胡须的海豹。北极熊的新陈代谢需要大量的脂肪，因此北极熊每天通常会消耗超过4磅的海豹脂肪。
item.author: Paul Nicklen, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Holy Lights
item.description:
In this picture from the March 1966 issue, a woman lights a candle in a Russian Orthodox church in Moscow. At the time, atheism was state-mandated, and membership to a religious organization could disqualify you from jobs.
在这张1966年3月发行的照片中，一位妇女在莫斯科的俄罗斯东正教教堂点燃蜡烛。当时，无神论是国家规定的，加入一个宗教组织可能会取消你的工作资格。
item.author: Dean Conger, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Snowy Square
item.description:
Women walk through the snow to St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow, Russia. One of the most iconic symbols of Russia, construction for the cathedral began in 1555 under Ivan the Terrible.
俄罗斯，莫斯科，女人们穿过雪地走向圣巴兹尔大教堂。大教堂是俄罗斯最具标志性的标志之一，始建于1555年恐怖伊万的统治下。
item.author: Sisse Brimberg, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Getting the Shot
item.description:
Photographer Des Bartlett photographs snow and blue geese from the back of a station wagon in the Arizona desert. For the December 1973 issue, Bartlett and his wife Jen studied geese as they flew from the Canadian subarctic to the Gulf of Mexico.
摄影师德斯巴特利特在亚利桑那沙漠拍摄旅行车后座上的雪和蓝鹅。在1973年12月的一期中，巴特利特和他的妻子詹研究了从加拿大亚北极地区飞往墨西哥湾的鹅。
item.author: Des and Jen Bartlett, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Toys and Touch
item.description:
In this picture from the September 1949 issue, visually impaired boys at the Minnesota Braille and Sight Saving School arrange a toy farm in an exercise to improve their sense of touch.
在这张1949年9月发行的照片中，明尼苏达州盲文和视力拯救学校的视障男孩安排了一个玩具农场来锻炼他们的触觉。
item.author: B. Anthony Stewart and Jack E. Fletcher, Nat Geo Image Collection
